data.title: A Little Princess (1995)
data.meta_description: A Little Princess (1995) – Gateway Film Center
data.text:
Country: United States

Language: English, French

Screening as part of From Book to Film 2022. Visit Ticket Center the day of the screening to reserve your spot!

About the film:

When her father leaves to fight in WWII, born-storyteller Sara is sent to boarding school where the severe headmistress tries to stifle her creative spirit. Based on the novel by Frances Hodgson Burnett.

“That rarest of creations, a children’s film that plays equally well to kids and adults… An exquisite, perfectly played serious fantasy that movingly stresses the importance of magic and the imagination”

—Todd McCarthy for Variety

About the filmmaker:

Four-time Academy Award-winner and festival favorite Alfonso Cuarón studied cinema and philosophy before shooting his critically acclaimed first film, Love in the Time of Hysteria (1991). His feature films include A Little Princess (1995), Great Expectations (1998), Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (2004), and Children of Men (2006). Cuarón also took part in the collective film, Paris, I Love You, presented in 2006 at the opening of Un Certain Regard in Cannes.
